title: SKBitmap.Decode return is null

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Do you have any details on what type of image was encoded? (png, jpg)
What you can also do is to save `ImageData` to a file (just a direct write bytes) and see if the OS can read the file. It may be corrupted. I don't think skia removed any decoders, so it may be something else.

comments.author: xiangzLL
comments.body: sorry,It's my code problem, i will close this issue. Thx

comments.author: parthipanr
comments.body: @xiangzLL  I am also facing same issue. can you please let me know how you resolve this issue?

comments.author: xiangzLL
comments.body:
it's my code problem,my image byte array is wrong.maybe we are not facing the same issue.
or you can show the codes, let me help you.

comments.author: DanteMarshal
comments.body:
I'm facing the same issue using `SKBitmap.Decode(string fileName)` and strangely, the results are randomly null !
It's a lot like returning the Decode method soon without having some Async operation finished first (I'm not sure if it's using async, It just looks like that cuz it's random !)
